text: is a city in Toyama Prefecture, Japan. ==History== Uozu developed as a castle town.Lewis, Michael. (2000). Becoming Apart: National Power and Local Politics in Toyama, 1868-1945, p. 46. In 1582, the forces of Oda Nobunaga forced the Uesugi clan to give up control of Uozu Castle. In 1918, riots started in Uozo because of increases in rice prices.Lewis, Becoming Apart, p. 259; Lewis, Michael. (1990). Rioters and Citizens: Mass Protest in Imperial Japan, p. 50.
